issue.title: OSMesa backend

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
This adds basic support for using OSMesa to create an in-memory rendering surface and OpenGL context.  Many of the GLFW entry points (cursors, window positioning, etc) are no-ops or stubs since they don't make sense in this context.  Also, input events don't work at all, since there's not really a good way for an offscreen window to gain input focus.

Since none of the existing examples made it obvious that this was actually working, I created duplicate examples of the simple and particles examples that will run briefly, then dump the framebuffer to an image file and exit.  These examples are only compiled when OSMesa is enabled.

body: See the `osmesa` branch for a headless implementation of OSMesa support. This will probably be included in the next release.

Support for OSMesa context creation on all supported backends has been added with e9560ef021c101def23a5c3b383d057b2a0e58d3.

Sorry for the long delay. Perhaps this is still useful to some of you.

repository.name: drishti
repository.description: Real time eye tracking for embedded and mobile devices.

issue.body:
A number of changes related to gpu testing, related code and cmake cleanup, the ogles_gpgpu dependency, and silent GTest logs

* Add drishti_gltest for portable windowless GLContext
  + GLFWContext : public GLContext (NOT (IOS OR ANDROID))
  + QGLContext : public GLContext
* global query replace in filenames, C++, and CMakeLists.txt: s/qtplus/gltest/g
* disable qt + mobile (IOS OR ANDROID) GPU gtests for drishti_{hci,acf,drishti}
* control clang formatting w/ on/off switches
* disable logging during gtests
  + add silent option to turn loggin goff
  + add option to name logger for FaceTracker
  + remove unused threshold shader param for Nms2
* add simple test-ogles_gpgpu for ogles_gpgpu sanity test (link, etc)
* ogles_gpgpu package: add find_dependency(OpenGL)
* prefer lower case for local (i.e. not option) vars in some cases
* rework some preprocessor logo: prefer `#if defined(SOME_DEFINE)` to `#if SOME_DEFINE` (is 0 or NOT)
